intro: Guatteria alutacea, commonly known as the white-flowered guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom during the wet season. Its fruits are fleshy berries that contain several seeds, and the plant is often found in understory layers of the rainforest. Guatteria alutacea plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various animals and contributing to forest biodiversity.
